# Elton John singles discography

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to navigation Jump to search

[Elton John](/wiki/Elton_John "Elton John") singles discography  
---  
[![Elton John 2011 Shankbone
2.JPG](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d1/Elton_John_2011_Shankbone_2.JPG/220px-
Elton_John_2011_Shankbone_2.JPG)](/wiki/File:Elton_John_2011_Shankbone_2.JPG)Elton
John attending the premiere of _The Union_ at the 2011 [Tribeca Film
Festival](/wiki/Tribeca_Film_Festival "Tribeca Film Festival")  
Singles as main artist|  133  
Singles as featured artist|  17  
Other appearances|  47  
  
The singles discography of British musician/singer-songwriter [Elton
John](/wiki/Elton_John "Elton John") consists of 133 official singles and 17
as featured artist, as well as 47 other non-single guest appearances. Across
his career, John has yielded 57 top 40 hits in the [United
States](/wiki/United_States "United States"), second only to [Elvis
Presley](/wiki/Elvis_Presley "Elvis Presley") in total,[1] with 27 of those
hitting the top ten and 9 achieving number-one. In his native [United
Kingdom](/wiki/United_Kingdom "United Kingdom"), he has accumulated 69 top 40
singles, including 32 top tens and 7 number-ones. In 1997, John released the
[double A-side](/wiki/A-side_and_B-side#Double_A-side "A-side and B-side")
single "[Something About the Way You Look
Tonight](/wiki/Something_About_the_Way_You_Look_Tonight "Something About the
Way You Look Tonight")"/"[Candle in the Wind
1997](/wiki/Candle_in_the_Wind_1997 "Candle in the Wind 1997")" in dedication
to the memory of [Diana, Princess of Wales](/wiki/Diana,_Princess_of_Wales
"Diana, Princess of Wales"). It subsequently hit number-one in every country
that it charted in and became the biggest selling single of all-time since the
UK and US charts began in the 1950s, with sales of 33 million.[2] John has
sold 100 million singles worldwide.[3]
